      java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,CustomBossBar> addGlobalBarToOnline(java.lang.String message, float percent)
      Set a message for all players.
      It will remain there for each player until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.

      void setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, CustomBossBar cbb, java.lang.String message, float percent)
      Set a message for the given player.
      It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
      This method will show a health bar using the given percentage value and will cancel any running timers.
      void setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, CustomBossBar cbb, java.lang.String message, int seconds)
      Set a message for the given player.
      It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
      This method will use the health bar as a decreasing timer, all previously started timers will be cancelled.
      The timer starts with a full bar.
      The health bar will be removed automatically if it hits zero.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getAPI

        public static BossBarAPI getAPI()
        Get the instance of this API so that you can then use it.
        Returns:
        The instance of the API

      • handleQuit

        public void handleQuit(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Handle a player quitting the server, eg. remove all boss bars
        Parameters:
        player - The player who has quit

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       CustomBossBar bar,
                       java.lang.String message)
        Set a message for the given player.
        It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
        This method will show a full health bar and will cancel any running timers.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should see the given message.
        message - The message shown to the player.
        Due to limitations in Minecraft this message cannot be longer than 64 characters.
        It will be cut to that size automatically.

      • addGlobalBarToOnline

        public java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,CustomBossBar> addGlobalBarToOnline(java.lang.String message,
                                                                        float percent)
        Set a message for all players.
        It will remain there for each player until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
        This method will show a health bar using the given percentage value and will cancel any running timers.
        Parameters:
        message - The message shown to the player.
        Due to limitations in Minecraft this message cannot be longer than 64 characters.
        It will be cut to that size automatically.
        percent - The percentage of the health bar filled.
        This value must be between 0F (inclusive) and 100F (inclusive).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the percentage is not within valid bounds.

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       CustomBossBar cbb,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       float percent)
        Set a message for the given player.
        It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
        This method will show a health bar using the given percentage value and will cancel any running timers.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should see the given message.
        message - The message shown to the player.
        Due to limitations in Minecraft this message cannot be longer than 64 characters.
        It will be cut to that size automatically.
        percent - The percentage of the health bar filled.
        This value must be between 0F (inclusive) and 100F (inclusive).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the percentage is not within valid bounds.

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       CustomBossBar cbb,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       int seconds)
        Set a message for the given player.
        It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
        This method will use the health bar as a decreasing timer, all previously started timers will be cancelled.
        The timer starts with a full bar.
        The health bar will be removed automatically if it hits zero.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should see the given timer/message.
        message - The message shown to the player.
        Due to limitations in Minecraft this message cannot be longer than 64 characters.
        It will be cut to that size automatically.
        seconds - The amount of seconds displayed by the timer.
        Supports values above 1 (inclusive).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If seconds is zero or below.

      • getBars

        public java.util.List<CustomBossBar> getBars(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Gets the list of bossbars a player has
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        Returns:
        the list of bars

      • addBar

        public CustomBossBar addBar(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                            java.lang.String message,
                            org.bukkit.boss.BarColor color,
                            org.bukkit.boss.BarStyle style,
                            org.bukkit.boss.BarFlag... flags)
        Adds a bar to a player
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add the bar to
        message - The message to be displayed
        color - The color of the bar
        style - The style of the bar
        flags - The flags to set
        Returns:
        The bar added

      • addBarWithProgress

        public CustomBossBar addBarWithProgress(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                        java.lang.String message,
                                        double progress,
                                        org.bukkit.boss.BarColor color,
                                        org.bukkit.boss.BarStyle style,
                                        org.bukkit.boss.BarFlag... flags)
        Adds a bar to a player
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add the bar to
        message - The message to be displayed
        progress - The progress between 0.0 (empty) and 1.0 (full). Make -1 for the bar to tick down as time passes
        color - The color of the bar
        style - The style of the bar
        flags - The flags to set
        Returns:
        The bar added

      • addBarForSeconds

        public CustomBossBar addBarForSeconds(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                      java.lang.String message,
                                      double seconds,
                                      org.bukkit.boss.BarColor color,
                                      org.bukkit.boss.BarStyle style,
                                      org.bukkit.boss.BarFlag... flags)
        Adds a bar to a player
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add the bar to
        message - The message to be displayed
        seconds - The time, in seconds, for the bar to be visible. Set to 0 for the bar to last forever
        color - The color of the bar
        style - The style of the bar
        flags - The flags to set
        Returns:
        The bar added

      • addBar

        public CustomBossBar addBar(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                            java.lang.String message,
                            double progress,
                            double seconds,
                            org.bukkit.boss.BarColor color,
                            org.bukkit.boss.BarStyle style,
                            org.bukkit.boss.BarFlag... flags)
        Adds a bar to a player
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add the bar to
        message - The message to be displayed
        progress - The progress between 0.0 (empty) and 1.0 (full). Make -1 for the bar to tick down as time passes
        seconds - The time, in seconds, for the bar to be visible. Set to 0 for the bar to last forever
        color - The color of the bar
        style - The style of the bar
        flags - The flags to set
        Returns:
        The bar added

        public boolean hasBar(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Checks whether the given player has a bar.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who should be checked.
        Returns:
        True, if the player has a bar, False otherwise.

      • removeAllBars

        public void removeAllBars(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Removes the bars from the given player.
        If the player has no bar, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose bar should be removed.

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                      CustomBossBar bar,
                      float percent)
        Modifies the health of an existing bar.
        If the player has no bar, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose bar should be modified.
        percent - The percentage of the health bar filled.
        This value must be between 0F and 100F (inclusive).

      • getHealth

        public float getHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                       CustomBossBar bar)
        Get the health of an existing bar.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose bar's health should be returned.
        Returns:
        The current absolute health of the bar.
        If the player has no bar, this method returns -1.

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                   CustomBossBar bar)
        Get the message of an existing bar.
        Parameters:
        player - The player whose bar's message should be returned.
        Returns:
        The current message displayed to the player.
        If the player has no bar, this method returns an empty string.
